{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3426932,"name":"Guilherme Samuel","username":"megarubber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-24T23:55:39.428Z","cooked":"

I tested a SparkMax brushed today (Brake mode) and it powers the CIM motor with max percentage, after turning on the robot, and no any command are sent on code (robotPeriodic method). How can I stop the SparkMax to do this?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-24T23:56:15.329Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":38,"reads":169,"readers_count":168,"score":228.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":471825,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode","display_username":"Guilherme Samuel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":47943,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode/471825/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3426965,"name":"Tim Winters","username":"ArchdukeTim","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/archduketim/{size}/256125_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-25T00:52:06.071Z","cooked":"
megarubber:

SparkMax brushed today (Brake mode)

Brake mode and brushed mode have nothing to do with each other. If you’re trying to control a brushed motor, you need to set the spark max to be in brushed mode.

It’s the Idle Mode, and the motor controller blinks blue. I already set it to brushed mode.

Might be a code issue then? Can you share it?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-25T02:27:11.918Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":121,"readers_count":120,"score":34.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":471825,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode","display_username":"Tim Winters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":47943,"username":"megarubber","name":"Guilherme Samuel","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":19820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"78 AIR Strike Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode/471825/4","custom_user_title":"78 AIR Strike Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3426993,"name":"Guilherme Samuel","username":"megarubber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-25T02:42:58.989Z","cooked":"
import wpilib
import wpilib.drive
import rev 

class TestRobot(wpilib.TimedRobot):
    def robotInit(self):
        # Initialize motors using CAN IDs
        self.left_front_motor = rev.CANSparkMax(50, rev.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType.kBrushed)
        self.left_rear_motor = rev.CANSparkMax(51, rev.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType.kBrushed)
        self.right_front_motor = rev.CANSparkMax(53, rev.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType.kBrushed)
        self.right_rear_motor = rev.CANSparkMax(52, rev.CANSparkLowLevel.MotorType.kBrushed)

        # Group left and right motors
        self.left = wpilib.MotorControllerGroup(self.left_front_motor, self.left_rear_motor)
        self.right = wpilib.MotorControllerGroup(self.right_front_motor, self.right_rear_motor)

        self.right.setInverted(True)

        # Set up differential drive for arcade driving
        self.robot_drive = wpilib.drive.DifferentialDrive(self.left, self.right)

        # Initialize joystick for controlling the robot
        self.joystick = wpilib.Joystick(0)

    def autonomousInit(self):
        pass

    def autonomousPeriodic(self):
        pass

    def teleopInit(self):
        self.robot_drive.setExpiration(0.1)
        self.robot_drive.setSafetyEnabled(True)

    def axis(self):
        if self.joystick.getRawAxis(3) > 0:
            return -self.joystick.getRawAxis(3)
        elif self.joystick.getRawAxis(4) > 0:
            return self.joystick.getRawAxis(4)
        return 0      

    def teleopPeriodic(self):
        # Get joystick axis values for movement and rotati on
        move_value = self.axis()  # Y-axis
        rotate_value = self.joystick.getRawAxis(0)  # X-axis

        # Use arcade drive to move the robot
        self.robot_drive.arcadeDrive(move_value, rotate_value)

What joystick or gamepad are you using to control the robot? Is it possible that axis 3 or 4 is defaulting to something other than 0?

If you print out move_value, rotate_value, and the values from motor.get() you should be able to figure out if it’s a code error.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2024-09-25T14:29:50.310Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":65,"readers_count":64,"score":33.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":471825,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-brushed-in-brake-mode/471825/6","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3427571,"name":"Guilherme Samuel","username":"megarubber","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/megarubber/{size}/172063_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T02:23:39.714Z","cooked":"
Max_Morehead:

What joystick or gamepad are you using to control the robot? Is it possible that axis 3 or 4 is defaulting to something other than 0?

I’m using a Dualshock 4 without external software (e.g. DS4Windows) and the default value of axis 3 and 4 is 1, but I’ve changed to left stick axes (equivalent to 0 and 1) and it’s still running without commands.

Max_Morehead:

If you print out move_value, rotate_value, and the values from motor.get() you should be able to figure out if it’s a code error.

I’ve changed this SparkMax to a new that we have leftover and the motor stops normally. That’s crazy, because some days later, the robot works perfectly and we haven’t touched in its electronics/control system.

I think that is a internal specific SparkMax problem, but I never have seen this issue before.

Sorry for not showing the logging results of move_value and rotate_value, but the error is probably not from the code. I’m not with the robot now.
